string.text: Stay where you are, you bitch! You take another step and you’re dead…
Markus, it’s me. What’s wrong?

I was led out of the spatial anomaly by an old man. He called himself “Hermit.” When he brought me to this place, he said that I would be safe here, and he told me something about you and Stronglav. He said that you were the one who somehow created the creature after you were caught in a blowout in the Cordon, and since then, Stronglav has been around you the whole time. He was only able to manifest himself as a separate entity from you after you stepped into this spatial distortion.
That’s hard to believe… but if it’s true, how do we destroy this thing?
I don’t know, but you need to warn the others. We need to be ready for Stronglav.
All right. Let’s go warn the others.
Don’t try your luck, you filth! Hermit told me everything; do you think I’m gonna believe you’re the real Beast? I’m not stupid…
It’s really me, Markus: Beast. I don’t know what that old man told you, but it is me.
Yeah? And how are you going to explain your attempt on my life? When I followed you into this spatial bubble, you attacked me. How do you explain that?
What? But it wasn’t me. It was probably Stronglav causing trouble. I’ve never tried to kill you.
Maybe you’re telling the truth, but I’m not about to lower my gun. What are you doing here?

I came here from the outpost. Those damn Monolith fanatics caught Savage and hauled him into the laboratory. I tried to save him, but he ended up dying to Stronglav. I blew up the lab entrance so that Stronglav would remain trapped inside, and I hope we never see that bastard again.

Don’t you understand? Beast… That creature, Stronglav, who has a connection to you, won’t be easy to get rid of. I’m sure he followed you here. Hermit told me about your tie to Stronglav. Wherever you go, he’ll follow you.
What? Markus, what connection are you talking about?
Greetings, Beast. Here we are again. Listen to me carefully… I don’t have much time: Stronglav has grown in power. He’s trying to control my mind, but I can resist him for the moment…
What are you talking about? Stronglav couldn’t have come to here. I blew up the passage that leads into lab X7 and trapped him.
You’re just lucky, but luck won’t keep you around forever. Remember: as long as you’re alive, Stronglav will continue to exist.
So the only way to destroy him is to kill myself?
Yes. Unfortunately, that is the only way. Behold: your old pistol. I found it… somewhere… Ah, hell. It doesn’t make any difference now.
Why didn’t you bring us out of the anomaly that one time? You helped me, but what about the guys: Sledgehammer and Marcus?

I couldn’t. You had to understand everything and go this way. There were no other options… Resisting him is getting more difficult… Promise me that when you meet face to face with Stronglav, you will make the right choice… Farewell, Beast…
I promise. Goodbye, old man.
No, Beast. You’re making a mistake, and there’s much that you don’t know… Stronglav is here, and he’s after you, wherever you might go. Your connection to him is deeper than you might think.
What? What connection are you talking about?
Do you remember the blowout at the Cordon? The one you were hit by? Didn’t you, after waking up, feel some part of you wasn’t with you anymore? Did you feel the emptiness inside?
What are you saying, and how do you know about the emission?

Don’t be fooled. I’ve been following you for a long time, and there is much I know about you… After the emission, part of your soul broke away from you, and that part has taken your main qualities with it… and since then, this splinter has always accompanied you; always watched you; but… he has been able manifest himself as a separate entity only after your appearance in the spatial bubble, the energy of which has made him very strong, but has not given him a physical shape…
So… I created this beast? How can I stop it?

Stop it?! I’m afraid you won’t like this method… Stronglav’s current goal is to attain a material body, but the only body that he can move into is yours… If he does this, then your mind will disappear forever; *you* will disappear forever…
He has already tried to conquer my conscience, but nothing has come of it.
What are you doing here, mercenary? What was that blast you made?
What I’m doing here?! I went through the lab and tried to save a friend, which went to all hell. I had to block the way to your station in order to stop the creature that was chasing me.
Okay. I’ll show you where he is, but if you try to do anything stupid, you’ll have yourself to blame.
Don’t worry. I won’t do anything.

What?… You came from the lab? Well, the fact that you blocked the path is a good thing… The outpost you came from has been closed for a long time; the mutants constantly barged into it and attacked us. We very rarely go there, and if we do, only to grab the equipment from the warehouse. And what kind of creature were you trying to stop?
It’s hard to describe. I can only say that it’s been chasing me from the moment I ended up in the spatial anomaly, even after leaving it.

It can’t be… Another one. A stalker came to us a few days ago and claimed that he got out of the anomaly as well. We didn’t believe his nonsense, because his condition was bad, but now, we’ve got the same situation… So how do you feel, merc?
I’ll live. Can you please tell me the stalker’s name?
Well, I can’t say for sure, but he said that he goes by Markus. Why do you ask? Think you might know him?
I know him. Where is he?
He’s still here, helping scientists in the lab.
Okay. Can you show me where it is?
Hah! We meet again, Beast! I like your new look. You’ll certainly go hand in hand with those fanatics.
This isn’t the time or place for us to be talking, Hatchet. You better get the hell out of here, or else, I’ll be dealing with you personally!

Well, you’re not very polite. Time changes everyone, Beast, but you remain unchanged. From the very first day that Fish saved you, I knew you were a real asshole. You betrayed everyone! You even betrayed the one who taught you everything; the one who thought of you as a brother, and was willing to give you one last mag of ammo. Why are you snubbing those who would protect you?
Shut the fuck up, Hatchet! You can’t judge me; you don’t know who I am! I’m going to warn you one last time: put the gun down and get out of here while you still can… and take your boys with you.
Not only are you king of the pricks, but you’ve got lot of fucking nerve. We’ll have to knock it out of your stupid head with some help from the eggheads!
Just try, Hatchet. I gave you the chance to leave…
Damn it, Beast. You shouldn’t have followed me… This thing… It came out of nowhere; it’s driving the fanatics mad, and it’s trying to get into my head. It lured you here, Beast.
Savage, what the fuck are you on about? That bastard’s still out there somewhere. Come on, buddy. We’ve got to get out of here.

No, no, no. It’s too late. Listen, Beast: Petrovich showed me how to reconfigure your PDA. You won’t be confused with the fanatics any longer. Aaah… It’s trying to get into my head again!… Stop it, Beast! Please… Don’t worry about me. I can keep on going.
I’ll stop it, Savage. I promise!
